definition: to be greedy in getting money
to have a voracious desire for/to covet/greedy/corrupt

sentences.english: For money is a root of allkinds of evil.
In other words, to maintain self, to face the reality, not greedy for profit.
sentences.chinese: 換言之，要保持自我，面對現實，不可貪財圖利。

sentences.english: The exploiting class lusts for riches.
James reminds us that greed kills generosity.
sentences.chinese: 雅各提醒我們，貪財能扼殺慷慨樂善的心。

sentences.english: She love leisure and hate labour, is extremely greedy.
sentences.chinese: 好逸惡勞的她，是極度貪財的。

sentences.english: The greedy parents forced her to marry a man who was twice as old as she was.
sentences.chinese: 貪財的父母強迫她嫁給一個年齡比她大一倍的男人。

sentences.english: I'm tired of these money-hungry developers.
sentences.chinese: 我已經厭倦了這些貪財的開發商。

sentences.english: Greedy people will come to no good end.
sentences.chinese: 貪財的人絕不會有好下場。

sentences.english: Don't let thrift degenerate into avarice.
Did I uncover evidence of cupidity among our would-be legislators?
sentences.chinese: 我是否找到這些未來議員們貪財的一些證據呢？

sentences.english: Emboli in the Zhao Fu soon learn bad, mercenary and sensual.
sentences.chinese: 栓子在趙府很快學壞，貪財好色。

sentences.english: And you can see particularly in this case that greediness must beavoided in handling other people's money.
sentences.chinese: 你可以看到，在管理別人的錢財時，必須要避免貪財。

sentences.english: At least Wall Street is honest about its greed and lust.
sentences.chinese: 至少，華爾街在自己貪財好色方面是誠實坦白的。

sentences.english: He can unshackle you from the love of money.
sentences.chinese: 祂就會把你從貪財的陷阱中釋放出來。

sentences.english: He enjoy riches most who needs them least.
sentences.chinese: 不貪財者最能享受財富。

definition: avaricious and insatiable (idiom); greedy and never satisfied
to fawn on/to curry favor with/to make up to
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
to run amok (idiom); to commit outrages
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
evil has its retribution (idiom); to suffer the consequences of one's bad deeds/sow the wind and reap the whirlwind (Hosea 8:7)
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
to use one's mouth (to say sth)
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
variant of 幫凶|帮凶[bang1 xiong1]
